data.title: American Express Student Internships and Graduate Opportunities
data.meta_description: Browse American Express student internship programs and opportunities for recent graduates. Find mentorship, get hands on experience, and more.
data.text:
Internship Program

During the internship program, you will work on real business projects to enable our customers around the globe to achieve their goals. The internship will be part of students' course curriculum and industry relevant credit Programs.

Our recruitment process in India is done through universities. During university events throughout the year, we will get to know you and hear why you're passionate about joining Team Amex and help determine what roles you might be a good fit to apply for. We will then work with the campus teams from those local universities to communicate application and interview steps with the goal of hiring best-in-class talent across various career areas to join us.

Programs Offered:

8 Week Summer Program offered: April - June

24 Week Summer Program offered: January - June

24 Week Winter Program offered: July - December

Who is eligible: For the 8-week internship, students must be in their penultimate year of study in the field of Engineering or in a Masters program for Economics and Business Administration where they can apply in tandem with their academic course curriculum and university policy.

For the 24-week internship, students should be in their final year of receiving their bachelors in the field of Engineering where they can apply for the program in tandem with their academic course curriculum and university policy.

Our internships are currently offered as hybrid working arrangements in Gurgaon and Bangalore depending upon business requirements.

Internship Program

Our 6-12 months internships provide high-performing individuals with exciting projects aligned to the company's strategic, operational, or financial goals. Undergraduates/Masters students and recent graduates will work on challenging projects and learn about our culture while networking across our diverse business units and regions.

Program Offered: April, July, November

When to apply:

April Program: February - March

July Program: May - June

November Program: September - October

Who is eligible: Recent graduates or students in their last semester of study

Our internships are currently offered as hybrid arrangements in Madrid.

Graduate Full-Time Program

Upon joining Amex as a full-time colleague, you will be enrolled into our 6-month Graduate Full-Time Program. Over the course of the program, you will receive the tools you need to develop your career – from skills training and networking to global learning sessions, including bespoke educational talks from senior leaders across the enterprise.

Programs Offered: September

*Note: Eligible students will join as full-time colleagues before the program starts

When to apply: April – June

Who is eligible: Recent English & Japanese bilingual graduates from undergraduate or graduate programs

Our graduate student roles are currtently offered as hybrid working arrangements in Tokyo.

Internship Program

Our 16-week internship gives you the chance to leverage your education to work on meaningful projects that positively impact our teams' success. You can look forward to a mix of on-the-job experience, training, networking and mentoring – everything you’ll need to develop both personally and professionally. This is a unique opportunity to join one of our many dynamic marketing functions including, but not limited to technical and traditional marketing roles within Lending, Acquisition, Member Engagement, Merchant Marketing, Insurance, New Product Development, Project Management and Product Marketing.

Programs Offered: Winter: January - April, Summer: May - August, Fall: September - December

When to apply:

Winter: September

Summer: January

Fall: May

Who is eligible: Current undergraduate & college students with a demonstrated interest in marketing and/or general management.

Our internships are currently offered as hybrid working arrangements in Toronto.

Early Student Program (ESP)

During our 4-month Early Student Program (ESP), you will have the opportunity to learn more about our business while leveraging your academic studies. By working on real business challenges and networking across the enterprise, you will get a feel for our unique, global culture.

The program is for students who are currently enrolled in Instituto Tecnologico de Monterrey (ITESM) and performance in the program will be used towards the student's university credits. The recruitment and application process is managed by the ITESM University.

Programs offered: Wave 1: February - June, Wave 2: August - December

When to apply: Wave 1: January, Wave 2: June - July

Who is eligible: Bachelors students from Instituto Tecnologico de Monterrey (ITESM) in their penultimate year of study

Our student opportunities are currently offered as hybrid working arrangements in Mexico City.

Round 1: Selected candidates will be invited to a screening to assess educational background and role fit.

Round 2: Candidates who pass the screening call will be invited to an interview with the business.

Round 3: Selected candidates will be invited to a final round interview or assessment centre that includes competency-based interviews, case studies, and group discussions to showcase your communication, analytical and collaboration skills.

Round 1: Phone interview with a recruiter focused on assessing soft skills needed for the role.​

Round 2: On-site interview at the Career Forum with the Business to discuss the candidate's professional experience and assess role fit.​

Round 3+: In person interview with the hiring leader at the local Amex office. Depending on the role, there could be up to 2 additional interview rounds.​

Undergraduate Internship​

Round 1: On-site group interview where the candidate will complete an assessment or presentation task aligned with the role.

Round 2: On-site one-on-one interview with hiring leader to get to know the candidate better and assess role fit.​

PhD Internship Program​

Round 1-3: Candidates will take part in a single day on-site with several business leaders at an assessment centre consisting of three rounds of interviews that assess candidates’ technical and coding abilities as well as their leadership and behavioral competencies.

Round 1: In-person interview with the University Director.​

Round 2: In-person interview with an Amex recruiter to evaluate student´s career interests, leadership skills and professional experience to assess role/project fit.​

Round 3: In-person interview with the Amex hiring leader to evaluate if the specific business project would be a good fit for the student.​

Round 4: Final interview (virtual or in-person) with business Director or VP Sponsor.
